intro: Costus nemotrichus, commonly known as the rough-costly, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric, and is characterized by its aromatic rhizomes. The plant features narrow, strap-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with a distinctive yellow or orange color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
